issue.subject: Adding the version of the component to JS and CSS assets

journals.notes:
The idea to mark js versions and avoid unsing old cached is very good !

But:
1) Shouldn't we use something more granular, this would be cool also for devs and tests ? For example, like we have in build-infos containing svn revision "4.4.0-r9412".

2) I'm not fan of reading the XML, it's a heavy process (and will have to be done maaaany times if you do it like this).

I would prefer that we write the version somewhere on build, like in PHP file... and why not have it read and store in a singleton style in sdiFactory.
That way we could use : @$document->addScript('administrator/components/com_easysdi_core/libraries/easysdi/view/view.js?v='.sdiFactory::getSdiBuildVersion());@

@sdiFactory::getSdiBuildVersion()@ should read the value from file on first call and store it statically for next calls.
Yves' proposal is accepted by the TC.

journals.notes:
rev. 9497+9501 As proposed, the version is available in sdiFactory: * sdiFactory::getSdiVersion() returns the semver verison (eg. 4.4.0) * sdiFactory::getSdiFullVersion() returns the semver verison concatenated with last svn revision(eg. 4.4.0-9458) For assets versioning, I suggest to use the full version (to ease developers work), example: 

$doc->addScript($base_url . '/js/easysdi_processing.js?v=' . sdiFactory::getSdiFullVersion());
I have done it for all JS and CSS assets that I have found. Note : *We should only do this for easdySDI assets, not for external libraries (jQuery, openlayers, proj, etc...)* Why ? * external libs should not be edited by easySDI devs * most of them are versioned in the path or filenames * they may be loaded by cms, framework or other plugin & modules, and they have to keep the simple URL for the Joomla's @addScript@ and @addStyleSheet@ mechanisms duplicate avoidance to work (@url@ is the array's key)
